clinical_study.brief_title: The Diagnostic Performance of Tilt Test in Athletes
clinical_study.official_title: The Diagnostic Performance of Tilt Test in Athletes and a Novel Strategy for Its Improvement

brief_summary.textblock: In the present study the investigators evaluate the sensitivity and specificity of passive tilt test in athletes, as well as their haemodynamic responses and autonomic nervous system activity during head-up tilt. Moreover, the investigators try to apply a novel algorithm for the improvement of diagnostic yield of tilt test in athletes.

detailed_description.textblock: We examine athletes with a history of reflex syncope and athletes without history of reflex syncope.All subjects undergo a tilt test, for the evaluation of haemodynamics, heart rate variability (HRV) and baroreflex sensitivity.

primary_outcome.measure: sensitivity and specificity of tilt test in athletes as measured by the occurence of syncope/presyncope during tilt test
primary_outcome.description: sensitivity = number of subjects with syncope/presyncope during tilt test/ number of subjects with a history of reflex syncope, specificity = number of subjects without syncope/presyncope during tilt test/ number of subjects without history of reflex syncope

secondary_outcome.measure: Parameters of haemodynamics during tilt test
secondary_outcome.description: We investigate whether the mean values of parameters of haemodynamics during tilt test can discriminate between athletes with a history of reflex syncope and those without history of syncope

secondary_outcome.measure: Parameters of heart rate variability during tilt test
secondary_outcome.description: We investigate whether the mean values of parameters of heart rate variability during tilt test can discriminate between athletes with a history of reflex syncope and those without history of syncope

secondary_outcome.measure: Parameters of baroreflex sensitivity during tilt test
secondary_outcome.description: We investigate whether the mean values of parameters of baroreflex sensitivity during tilt test can discriminate between athletes with a history of reflex syncope and those without history of syncope

arm_group.description: Passive tilt test in athletes with a history of reflex syncope
Passive tilt test in athletes without history of reflex syncope

intervention.description: Passive tilt test (without pharmacological provocation). After a horizontal supine rest period of 5 min, the tilt table was inclined at 60Â° head-up position for 30 min. A positive response was defined according to the European Society of Cardiology guidelines for the diagnosis and management of syncope

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 14-40 years old,
- more than 5 years of exercise training experience and competition at a regional level at different sports
Exclusion Criteria:
- smoking,
- recent alcohol consumption,
- presence of any chronic disease and use of drugs
